sentences.en: A political conference was held the following year , as provided in the Armistice Agreement.
sentences.cn: 按照停战协定的规定,翌年召开了政治会议.

sentences.en: After four years of bitter war, an armistice was signed.
sentences.cn: 在四年的战争苦难后, 终于签定了停战协议.

sentences.en: But at least an armistice will mean that men who would have died will now live.
sentences.cn: 但至少,停战意味着那些原本要死的人逃过一劫.

sentences.en: Finally, the Bolsheviks signed an armistice with Germany.
sentences.cn: 最终布尔什维克和德国签署了停战协议。

sentences.en: It was squarely up to me to decide whether or not the procurement of an armistice.
sentences.cn: 是否赢取停战协定之决定,完全落在我一人身上.

sentences.en: Kublai therefore agreed to an armistice with Sung and returned to Yenching early in 1260.
sentences.cn: 忽必烈因此同意与宋休战,并于1260年初回到燕京.

sentences.en: No special form for an armistice is prescribed.
On September 2 9, Bulgaria signed an armistice.
sentences.cn: 9月29日, 保加利亚签署停战协定.

sentences.en: On september 29, Bulgaria signed an armistice.
sentences.cn: 9月29日, 保加利亚签署停战协定.
抑或,至少是达成停战协议.

sentences.en: People celebrating the armistice behaved like an orgiastic mob.
sentences.cn: 庆祝停战的人们象一群狂欢的暴民.

sentences.en: The armistice did not spare France a pang.
sentences.cn: 停战协定并未使法国免遭剧烈的创伤.

sentences.en: The armistice went into effect at seven o'clock.
sentences.cn: 停战协定7点钟开始生效.

sentences.en: The two nations signed an armistice.
They will very likely try to wriggle out of the armistice terms.
sentences.cn: 他们很可能设法拒不实施停战协定的条款.

trans.tran_cn: 停火， 停战，休战协议，停战协议
